an4.138:1.1: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.
an4.138:1.3: One is on retreat in body, but not mind;
an4.138:1.4: one is on retreat in mind, but not body;
an4.138:1.5: one is on retreat in neither body nor mind; and
an4.138:1.6: one is on retreat in both body and mind.
an4.138:2.1: And how is an individual on retreat in body, but not mind?
an4.138:2.2: It’s when an individual frequents remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
an4.138:2.3: But they think sensual, malicious, and cruel thoughts.
an4.138:2.4: That’s how an individual is on retreat in body, but not mind.
an4.138:3.1: And how is an individual on retreat in mind, but not body?
an4.138:3.2: It’s when an individual doesn’t frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
an4.138:3.3: But they think thoughts of renunciation, good will, and harmlessness.
an4.138:3.4: That’s how an individual is on retreat in mind, but not body.
an4.138:4.1: And how is an individual on retreat in neither body nor mind?
an4.138:4.2: It’s when an individual doesn’t frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
an4.138:4.3: And they think sensual, malicious, and cruel thoughts.
an4.138:4.4: That’s how an individual is on retreat in neither body nor mind.
an4.138:5.1: And how is an individual on retreat in both body and mind?
an4.138:5.2: It’s when an individual frequents remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
an4.138:5.3: And they think thoughts of renunciation, good will, and harmlessness.
an4.138:5.4: That’s how an individual is on retreat in both body and mind.
an4.138:5.5: These are the four individuals found in the world.”
